items.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Mar 25 - Mar 31, 2019
items.summary: 21 awesome projects updated on Mar 25 - Mar 31, 2019
items.content_text:
### Mathematics / SpriteKit

*   [Guilloche Pattern Playground Book (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/TheWildHorse/GuillochePlayground) - Learn more about this pattern you see every day, but probably never knew it was really carefully designed. üçÅ

### PlaygroundBooks

*   [Accessibility (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/xReee/wwdc2018) - Accessibility for iOS developers. üçÅ
*   [TJBot Playground (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/jweisz/tjbot-playground) - Swift Playground for interacting with IBM's TJBot. üçÅ

### Learning Swift

*   [What's new in Swift 4 (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/ole/whats-new-in-swift-4) - An Xcode playground showing off the new features in Swift 4.0. üçÅ üåü
*   [What's new in Swift 4.2 (‚≠ê870)](https://github.com/ole/whats-new-in-swift-4-2) - An Xcode playground showing off the new features in Swift 4.2. üçÅ üåü
*   [Codable Playground (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/filip-zielinski/CodablePlayground) - Playground that demonstrates advanced uses of Codable. üçÅ
*   [Generics In Swift](https://github.com/LukeSkywalker55/Generics-In-Swift) - Playground that explains generics. üçÅ
*   [Swift String Cheat Sheet (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/kharrison/Playground-Strings) - A quick guide to using Strings with Swift. üçÅ
*   [About Swift (‚≠ê84)](https://github.com/NicolaLancellotti-About/About-Swift) - A playground about Swift language.  üçÅ

### Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Design Patterns

*   [The Principles of OOD in Swift 4 (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/ochococo/OOD-Principles-In-Swift) - The Principles of OOD based on Uncle Bob articles.üçÅ

### Theoretical Computer Science / Functional Reactive Programming

*   [Functional Debug View (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/tomquist/DebugView) - Playground to visualize functional programming with graphical sequences. üçÅ üåü
*   [OOP with Functions in Swift (‚≠ê59)](https://github.com/iamleeg/OOPInFPInSwift) - Object-Oriented Programming in Functional Programming in Swift. üçÅ

### Theoretical Computer Science / Algorithms and Data Structures

*   [Animated Sorting Algorithms (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/p-sun/Animated-Sorting-Algorithms) - Swift 4 playgrounds to view and manipulate sorting algorithms.üçÅ
*   [Expressions (‚≠ê396)](https://github.com/mpangburn/Expressions) - Arithmetic and logical expressions elegantly modeled and visualized using protocol-oriented binary trees.üçÅ

### Theoretical Computer Science / Languages

*   [Introduction to Compilers (‚≠ê473)](https://github.com/ahoppen/introduction-to-compilers) - Great introduction to the inner workings of compilers. üçÅüåü
*   [Pascal Interpreter (‚≠ê286)](https://github.com/igorkulman/SwiftPascalInterpreter) - Simple Swift interpreter for the Pascal language inspired by the Let‚Äôs Build A Simple Interpreter article series. üçÅ

### UIKit And Graphics / SpriteKit

*   [SceneKit ARKit Demo (‚≠ê49)](https://github.com/mhanlon/ARKitDemoPlayground) - The Xcode 9 ARKit SpriteKit demo as a playground.üçÅ

### Playground Sets / SpriteKit

*   [Parks And Recreation (‚≠ê177)](https://github.com/zwaldowski/ParksAndRecreation) - Great collection of interesting playgrounds, for fun and for profit. üçÅüåü
*   [URaimo's Playgrounds (‚≠ê139)](https://github.com/uraimo/Swift-Playgrounds) - My playgrounds, various topics. üçÅ

### Miscellaneous / SpriteKit

*   [Rubik's Cube (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/codelynx/CoreRubiksCube) - Implementing basic model and behavior of Rubic's Cube in Swift. üçÅ
*   [SwiftChain](https://github.com/gg2001/SwiftChain) - Simple Cryptocurrency in a Swift Playground.

items.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Jan 14 - Jan 20, 2019
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Jan 14 - Jan 20, 2019
items.content_text:
### PlaygroundBooks

*   [AudioKit Playground Book (‚≠ê194)](https://github.com/audiokit/Playgrounds) - A set of playgrounds using AudioKit designed for the iPad Playgrounds app.

### Audio / SpriteKit

*   [Miles (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/lalomts/Miles) - A Swift Playground that creates jazz improvisations in any key using AudioToolbox and AVFoundation.

### Libraries and APIs / SpriteKit

*   [AudioKit Playgrounds](https://audiokit.io/playgrounds/) - 130+ Audio synthesis, processing, playback, and analysis playgrounds with AudioKit.
items.content_html:

Audio / SpriteKit

Libraries and APIs / SpriteKit

items.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Nov 20 - Nov 26, 2017
items.summary: 7 awesome projects updated on Nov 20 - Nov 26, 2017
items.content_text:
### PlaygroundBooks

*   [Tree Trouble Playbook (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/joelrorseth/Tree-Trouble) - An interactive Swift Playground Book about Binary Search Trees.
*   [Auto Pong (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/cardoso/AutoPong) - A tutorial to implement a pong based on a simple AI.
*   [Neural Network Playground (‚≠ê382)](https://github.com/hetelek/Neural-Network-Playground) - A neural network Swift playground, with no third party dependencies.
*   [Window Manager Playground (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/steventroughtonsmith/windowmanager-playgroundbook) - Playground for an experimental window manager.
*   [Numsw (‚≠ê133)](https://github.com/sonsongithub/numsw) - A swift playground book that mimics some of the features of numpy and jupyter notebook.
*   [File Browser Playground (‚≠ê205)](https://github.com/steventroughtonsmith/files-playgroundbook) - Simple File Browser for Swift Playgrounds on iOS.
*   [Geometry with Swift (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/dbbudd/Geometry-Swift-PlaygroundBook) - In this course your students will learn the fundamentals of Swift 3 programming, using geometry as their context for learning.
items.content_html:
PlaygroundBooks

  • Tree Trouble Playbook (‚≠ê25) - An interactive Swift Playground Book about Binary Search Trees.
  • Auto Pong (‚≠ê13) - A tutorial to implement a pong based on a simple AI.
  • Neural Network Playground (‚≠ê382) - A neural network Swift playground, with no third party dependencies.
  • Window Manager Playground (‚≠ê39) - Playground for an experimental window manager.
  • Numsw (‚≠ê133) - A swift playground book that mimics some of the features of numpy and jupyter notebook.
  • File Browser Playground (‚≠ê205) - Simple File Browser for Swift Playgrounds on iOS.
  • Geometry with Swift (‚≠ê10) - In this course your students will learn the fundamentals of Swift 3 programming, using geometry as their context for learning.

### Learning Swift: Advanced Topics

*   [Swift Regular Expressions (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/ogulcan/SwiftRegEx) - A playground to learn regular expressions with Swift.
*   [Network Stack (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/AndrejKolar/NetworkStack) - Clean & simple Swift networking stack playground.

### Apple's Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

*   [Apple's Balloons Playground](https://developer.apple.com/swift/blog/downloads/Balloons.zip) - The balloons playground showed at WWDC14. ‚è≥

### Theoretical Computer Science / Algorithms and Data Structures

*   [Duet-Inspired Trail Effect (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/dionlarson/Duet-Trail-Effect-SpriteKit-Playground) - How to get a Duet style trailing effect in SpriteKit.

items.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on May 29 - Jun 04, 2017
items.summary: 105 awesome projects updated on May 29 - Jun 04, 2017
items.content_text:
### Learning Swift

*   [The Swift Programming Language Playgrounds (‚≠ê228)](https://github.com/danielpi/Swift-Playgrounds) - 40+ playgrounds, one for each chapter of Apple's Swift book. üåü
*   [Swift Hack Pack (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/GuildSA/swift-hack-pack) - Collection of playgrounds that teaches Swift.
*   [The Swift Summary Book (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/jakarmy/swift-summary) - A summary of Apple's Swift language. üåü
*   [Swifter Tips (‚≠ê124)](https://github.com/swifter-tips/Playground) - Examples for every feature of the Swift language.
*   [MPCS51032 UChicago iOS Course (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/uchicago-mobi/mcps51032-2017-spring-playground) - Playgrounds from the 2017 Spring iOS course of the University of Chicago.

### Learning Swift: Advanced Topics

*   [A Swift Introduction to Core Data (‚≠ê154)](https://github.com/andyshep/CoreDataPlaygrounds) - Learn Core Data experimenting directly in this playground. üåü
*   [TDDSwiftPlayground (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/sshrpe/TDDSwiftPlayground) - Demonstration of using Swift Playgrounds in Test Driven Development with XCTest.
*   [Concurrency on iOS (‚≠ê32)](https://github.com/sammyd/2017AtSwift_Concurrency) - Concurrency and Parallelism in iOS.
*   [Modern Core Data (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/dfreniche/modern-core-data-playground) - An introduction to Core Data.
*   [Swift DSL Example (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/cfdrake/swift-dsl-example) - Implementation of a DSL in Swift.
*   [Katan (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/marciok/katan) - A micro web server that replies "Hello world!" to every request, an example of how to use sockets in Swift.
*   [Swiftly Typed Resources (‚≠ê74)](https://github.com/jstart/Swiftly-Typed-Resources) - A playground showing how Swift makes Strings, Colors, Fonts, Images, etc easier to deal with. ‚è≥
*   [Swift KVO Closures (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/rectalogic/KVOPlayground) - Swift KVO playground. ‚è≥
*   [Swift Date Tutorial (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/liuyubobobo/Swift-NSDate-Tutorial) - Learn everythig about NSDate. ‚è≥
*   [Swift And C (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/MacMark/SwiftAndC) - Examples about using C with Swift. ‚è≥
*   [Swift Memory Management (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/ndethore/swift-memory-management) - How to avoid retain cycles, from [this post](http://detho.re/2016/01/21/writing-memory-efficient-swift-code/). ‚è≥

### Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Design Patterns

*   [Design Patterns Playground (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/edopelawi/DesignPatternsPlayground) - Learning GoF's Design Patterns in Swift 3.
*   [iOS Design Patterns (‚≠ê140)](https://github.com/haxpor/ios-design-patterns) - Sample projects for MVC, MVP, MVVM, and VIPER.
*   [Design Patterns in Swift (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/ochococo/Design-Patterns-In-Swift) - Design patterns in Swift 3.

### Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Protocol Oriented Programming

*   [Swift Diagram Playgrounds (‚≠ê277)](https://github.com/alskipp/Swift-Diagram-Playgrounds) - Adaptation of the Protocol-Oriented Programming in Swift talk from WWDC 2015.
*   [Swift Protocol Extensions (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/davidahouse/SwiftProtocolExtensions) - A playground to explore Protocol Extensions. ‚è≥
*   [Battleship Example (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/vichudson1/Battleship-POP-Example) - An example of how to use Protocol Oriented Programming with the battleship game. ‚è≥

### Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Functional Reactive Programming

*   [ReactiveCocoa Playground (‚≠ê97)](https://github.com/nikita-leonov/ReactiveCocoaPlayground) - The easiest way to get a taste of ReactiveCocoa. ‚è≥
*   [Swift Reactive Playground (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/ColinEberhardt/SwiftReactivePlayground) - Companion to the article: ReactiveCocoa made Simple With Swift. ‚è≥

### Apple's Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

*   [Apple's Mandelbrot Playground (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/palmerc/Mandelbrot-Swift-Playground) - A playground with the mandelbrot fractal (updated to Swift 3 by @palmerc, @kemalenver).
*   [Apple's Crustacean Playground](https://developer.apple.com/sample-code/wwdc/2015/downloads/Crustacean.zip) - Protocol-Oriented Programming with Value Types. ‚è≥
*   [Apple's Swift Standard Library Playground](https://developer.apple.com/sample-code/swift/downloads/Standard-Library.zip) - experiment with Swift standard library types and high-level concepts using visualizations and practical examples. ‚è≥

### Playgrounds about Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

*   [XCTest Playground (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/Liquidsoul/XCTestPlayground) - Better looking tests for playgrounds.
*   [Interactive Playground (‚≠ê53)](https://github.com/dasdom/InteractivePlayground) - Exploring interactivity in Playgrounds.
*   [Mondrian (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/timbellay/Mondrian) - Make iOS app mockups in Swift 2.x playgrounds. ‚è≥

### Playgrounds from Playgroundbooks / Functional Reactive Programming

*   [iPad Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/kushtaneja/iPad_Swift_Playgrounds) - The sample playgroundbooks converted to playgrounds.

### Theoretical Computer Science / Functional Reactive Programming

*   [Logician (‚≠ê197)](https://github.com/mdiep/Logician) - Logic programming in Swift. üåü
*   [Function Composition in Swift (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/ijoshsmith/function-composition-in-swift) - Exploration of function composition in Swift. üåü
*   [Swift Adventures in Monad Land (‚≠ê172)](https://github.com/alskipp/Swift-Adventures-In-Monad-Land) - Learn about monads.
*   [Functional Design Patterns (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/cmvicentehe/FunctionalProgrammingDesignPatterns) - A few functional programming concept and patterns.
*   [Learn about transducers (‚≠ê80)](https://github.com/mbrandonw/learn-transducers-playground) - A little tutorial that explains transducers. ‚è≥
*   [Swift Functors, Applicatives, and Monads in Pictures (‚≠ê68)](https://github.com/mokacoding/Swift-Functors-Applicative-Monads-In-Pictures-Playground) - Companion to the article: Swift Functors, Applicatves, and Monads in Pictures. ‚è≥
*   [Functors in Swift (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/mokagio/Swift-Functor-Introduction-Playground) - A playground to introduce Functors in Swift, and their practical usage. ‚è≥

### Theoretical Computer Science / Algorithms and Data Structures

*   [Swift Algorithm Club (‚≠ê29k)](https://github.com/raywenderlich/swift-algorithm-club) - Algorithms and data structures in Swift with explanations. üåü
*   [Sorting Experiments](https://github.com/adrfer/Sort) - Alluring experiments with sorting algorithms in Swift, sort of.
*   [Visual Binary Trees (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/akpw/VisualBinaryTrees) - Effortless visualization of arbitrary Binary Trees, along with their pluggable traversal implementations. üåü
*   [Julia Fractal Playground (‚≠ê261)](https://github.com/gongzhang/julia-set-playground#julia-set-playground) - A Swift playground that generates beautiful Julia set fractal images.
*   [DataStructures Playground (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/oliverfoggin/DataStructuresPlayground) - Data Structures and Algorithms in Swift. ‚è≥
*   [Swiftography (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/sketchytech/Swiftography) - Standard cryptographic algorithms in a Swift Playground. ‚è≥
*   [Algorithms Playground (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/ashokgelal/AlgorithmsPlayground) - Various algorithm implementation in Swift. ‚è≥
*   [The Jelly Bean Problem (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/kyleweiner/Jelly-Bean-Problem) - The Jelly Bean problem from Wait But Why. ‚è≥
*   [Euclidean Strings (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/modulusMathews/ReEuclid) - A playground leveraging ReSwift to generate Euclidean Strings. ‚è≥

### Theoretical Computer Science / Languages

*   [Write your own language: Mu (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/marciok/Mu) - A playground explaining how to create a tiny programming language named Mu. üåü
*   [ASM Swift (‚≠ê106)](https://github.com/NSExceptional/ASM-Swift) - A playground for learning Assembly language through Swift. üåü
*   [Register VM (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/brianhill/register-vm-in-swift) - A register-based VM in a Swift playground. üåü ‚è≥
*   [Turtle Playground (‚≠ê126)](https://github.com/dimsumthinking/TurtlePlayground) - A playground with Logo-like commands. üåü ‚è≥
*   [Swift Brainfuck (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/xavieryao/Swift-Brainfuck) - Brainfuck interpreter written in Swift using Playground. ‚è≥

### UIKit And Graphics / Machine Learning

*   [UIStackView Playground (‚≠ê328)](https://github.com/dasdom/UIStackViewPlayground) - Interesting examples of use of UIStackViews.üåü
*   [Bezier Path Playgrounds (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/DigitalLeaves/BezierPathPlaygrounds) - Some playgrounds to better understand UIBezierPaths.
*   [UIKit playground (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/ralfebert/uikit-playground) - Playgrounds to experiment interactively with UIKit views.
*   [UIDynamic Playground (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/andresbrun/UIDynamicsPlayground) - Multiple Playgrounds using almost every behaviour of UIDynamic.
*   [WWDC16 Typography (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/tototti/wwdc16_typography_playground) üáØüáµ - Draw a logo or any text with the WWDC16 ASCII texture.
*   [Animated GIF Playground (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/danielrhammond/GIF-Playground) - Swift playground for generating animated GIFs.
*   [RPClarity (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/RobotsAndPencils/RPClarity) - Shows a technique for blurring an image behind the characters behind one or more UILabels. ‚è≥
*   [Swift Clock (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/nickoneill/swiftclock) - An animated clock in a swift playground. ‚è≥
*   [WatchKit Asset Playground (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/cwimberger/WatchKitAssetPlayground) - A swift playground for creating awesome animations for your WatchKit Apps. ‚è≥
*   [Swift 2.0 Protocol Extension Example (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/jhurray/Swift2-Protocol-Extension-Example) - Showing how to use Swift2 protocol extensions to render errors in UIViews and UIViewControllers without subclassing or creating classes. ‚è≥
*   [Tinting (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/Jesse-calkin/tinting) - A small playground to demonstrate image tinting in UIKit. ‚è≥
*   [Ray tracing Playground (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/mhorga/Raytracing) - A playground and a series of articles on ray tracing, see also part [2 (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/mhorga/Raytracing2), [3 (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/mhorga/Raytracing3), [4 (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/mhorga/Raytracing4), [5 (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/mhorga/Raytracing5) üåü ‚è≥
*   [WWDC16 Logo Playground](https://github.com/krutarth/WWDC16Logo) - Drawing the WWDC16 logo in a playground. ‚è≥

### UIKit And Graphics / Core Image

*   [Interpolation Playground (‚≠ê63)](https://github.com/FlexMonkey/Interpolation-Playground-) - Playground demonstrating lerp, smooth step, Catcall-Rom and others! ‚è≥
*   [CoreImage for Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê89)](https://github.com/FlexMonkey/CoreImageForSwiftPlaygrounds) - Growing collection of CoreImage playgrounds from the upcoming book "CoreImage For Swift". üåü ‚è≥
*   [Image Processor (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/mortenbrudvik/ImageProcessor) - Implementing different image filter algorithms. ‚è≥

### UIKit And Graphics / Metal

*   [METAL Playground (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/haawa799/METAL_Playground) - Apple Metal framework playground. üåü ‚è≥

### UIKit And Graphics / Animations

*   [Core Animation Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/rmirabelli/CoreAnimationSwiftPlaygrounds) - A set of interesting Core Animation playgounds.
*   [UIViewPropertyAnimator Playground (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/mathewsanders/Scrubber) - Playground demonstrating UIViewPropertyAnimator.
*   [WWDC Crowd Simulator 2017 (‚≠ê32)](https://github.com/neilsardesai/WWDC-Crowd-Simulator-2017) - A SpriteKit experiment to simulate the WWDC2017 logo crowd.
*   [Additive Animations (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/d-ronnqvist/Additive-Animations-Playground) - Experiment with multiple additive animations in Core Animation. ‚è≥
*   [Core Animation Playground (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/knightsc/CoreAnimationPlayground) - Companion to Apple's Core Animation Programming Guide. ‚è≥

### UIKit And Graphics / SpriteKit

*   [SpriteKit Swift 3 (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/MacMeDan/SpriteKitCollisions) - Playground for exploring Sprite Kit.
*   [SceneKit Examples (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/UCh/swift-scene-kit-playgrounds) - Experiment with SceneKit and Swift. ‚è≥

### Audio / SpriteKit

*   [Bach Playground (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/dreamwieber/BachPlayground) - A Simple Swift Playground that plays a brief piece by Bach with AVAudioEngine and AVMIDIPlayer.
*   [PlayerNode Playground (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/genedelisa/PlayerNodePlayground) - Playground using AVAudioEngine with a playernode and effects to play an audio file. üåü

### Mathematics / SpriteKit

*   [Lindenmayer Systems (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/henrinormak/lindenmayer) - A Swift playground exploring Lindemayer systems.
*   [Swift Natural Numbers (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/jakebromberg/Swift-Natural-Numbers) - A playground for implementing the natural numbers and more concepts in number theory.
*   [Polydoxical (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/kirkbyo/Polydoxical) - Interactive playground to experiment with roulettes and polygons.
*   [Swift Accelerate (‚≠ê120)](https://github.com/haginile/SwiftAccelerate) - Using the Accelerate framework and Swift for Linear Algebra. ‚è≥
*   [Swifty Mathematics (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/DylanModesitt/swiftyMathematics) - A collection of swift playground about mathematics. ‚è≥
*   [Numerical Algorithms](https://www.raywenderlich.com/99559/numeric-algorithms-using-playgrounds) - Numerical argorithms playground from Ray Wenderlich. ‚è≥

### Libraries and APIs / SpriteKit

*   [AIToolbox (‚≠ê801)](https://github.com/KevinCoble/AIToolbox/tree/master/Playgrounds) - A set of playgrounds showing machine learning algorithms, all implemented with pieces of the AIToolbox framework code.
*   [Cognitive Service APIs (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/codePrincess/playgrounds) - Get started with the Microsoft Cognitive Services APIs.
*   [Rx Playground (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/sgr-ksmt/RxPlayground) - A playground with RxSwift examples.

### Playground Sets / SpriteKit

*   [Public Extensions (‚≠ê299)](https://github.com/Jasdev/Public-Extension) - A set of useful extensions from [@PublicExtension](https://twitter.com/publicextension). üåü
*   [ManuelCarlos's Playgrouds](https://github.com/manuelCarlos/Swift-Playgrounds) - Various playgrounds.
*   [Sketchytech's Playgrounds (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/sketchytech/SwiftPlaygrounds) - Various Playgrounds. üåü ‚è≥
*   [Swift fun playgrounds (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/madbat/Swift-fun-playgrounds) - A few playgrounds to showcase Swift peculiar features. ‚è≥
*   [BradLarson's Playgrounds (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/BradLarson/PersonalSwiftPlaygrounds) - Various playgrounds. ‚è≥
*   [Dmikusa's Playgrounds (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/dmikusa/swift_playgrounds) - Playgrounds that show basic Swift, JSON parsing, sending HTTP requests and basic file IO. ‚è≥
*   [Cananito's Playgrounds (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/Cananito/Playgrounds) - Various playgrounds. ‚è≥
*   [Uberbruns's Playgrounds (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/uberbruns/SwiftPlaygrounds) - Various playgrounds. ‚è≥

### Miscellaneous / SpriteKit

*   [Icon Creator (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/tnantoka/IconCreator) - Create app icons on Swift playground.
*   [2048 Playground (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/robin/2048_Playground) - The 2048 game implemented with a playground.
*   [SwiftShell (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/JustinJiaDev/SwiftShell) - Bash shell in a playground.
*   [LaunchPad Playground (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/Juniorlimaivd/LaunchPad-Playground) - A playground that simulates a real LaunchPad for making music.
*   [Super Maze (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/W00dL3cs/Super-Maze) - A programmatic maze generator and solver.
*   [Tic Tac Toe (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/aabosh/Tic-Tac-Toe) - Tic tac toe in a playground.
*   [Game Boards (‚≠ê183)](https://github.com/joalbright/Gameboard) - Chess, checkers, tic-tac-toe, sudoku and many others in playground. üåü ‚è≥
*   [StarWars Seals (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/jeremyconkin/StarWarsSeals) - Emblems from Star Wars in Swift playgrounds via CoreGraphics and UIViews. ‚è≥
*   [SwiftFiles (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/sketchytech/SwiftFiles) - Save, Load and Delete files easily from within a Swift playground. ‚è≥
*   [Earth photos (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/jtbandes/DSCOVR.playground) - A slideshow of Earth photos taken by DSCOVR/EPIC. üåü ‚è≥
items.content_html:
Learning Swift

  • The Swift Programming Language Playgrounds (‚≠ê228) - 40+ playgrounds, one for each chapter of Apple's Swift book. üåü
  • Swift Hack Pack (‚≠ê23) - Collection of playgrounds that teaches Swift.
  • The Swift Summary Book (‚≠ê1.7k) - A summary of Apple's Swift language. üåü
  • Swifter Tips (‚≠ê124) - Examples for every feature of the Swift language.
  • MPCS51032 UChicago iOS Course (‚≠ê7) - Playgrounds from the 2017 Spring iOS course of the University of Chicago.

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics

  • A Swift Introduction to Core Data (‚≠ê154) - Learn Core Data experimenting directly in this playground. üåü
  • TDDSwiftPlayground (‚≠ê58) - Demonstration of using Swift Playgrounds in Test Driven Development with XCTest.
  • Concurrency on iOS (‚≠ê32) - Concurrency and Parallelism in iOS.
  • Modern Core Data (‚≠ê35) - An introduction to Core Data.
  • Swift DSL Example (‚≠ê20) - Implementation of a DSL in Swift.
  • Katan (‚≠ê25) - A micro web server that replies "Hello world!" to every request, an example of how to use sockets in Swift.
  • Swiftly Typed Resources (‚≠ê74) - A playground showing how Swift makes Strings, Colors, Fonts, Images, etc easier to deal with. ‚è≥
  • Swift KVO Closures (‚≠ê11) - Swift KVO playground. ‚è≥
  • Swift Date Tutorial (‚≠ê8) - Learn everythig about NSDate. ‚è≥
  • Swift And C (‚≠ê6) - Examples about using C with Swift. ‚è≥
  • Swift Memory Management (‚≠ê3) - How to avoid retain cycles, from this post. ‚è≥

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Design Patterns

  • Design Patterns Playground (‚≠ê27) - Learning GoF's Design Patterns in Swift 3.
  • iOS Design Patterns (‚≠ê140) - Sample projects for MVC, MVP, MVVM, and VIPER.
  • Design Patterns in Swift (‚≠ê15k) - Design patterns in Swift 3.

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Protocol Oriented Programming

  • Swift Diagram Playgrounds (‚≠ê277) - Adaptation of the Protocol-Oriented Programming in Swift talk from WWDC 2015.
  • Swift Protocol Extensions (‚≠ê20) - A playground to explore Protocol Extensions. ‚è≥
  • Battleship Example (‚≠ê13) - An example of how to use Protocol Oriented Programming with the battleship game. ‚è≥

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Functional Reactive Programming

  • ReactiveCocoa Playground (‚≠ê97) - The easiest way to get a taste of ReactiveCocoa. ‚è≥
  • Swift Reactive Playground (‚≠ê27) - Companion to the article: ReactiveCocoa made Simple With Swift. ‚è≥

Apple's Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

  • Apple's Mandelbrot Playground (‚≠ê24) - A playground with the mandelbrot fractal (updated to Swift 3 by @palmerc, @kemalenver).
  • Apple's Crustacean Playground - Protocol-Oriented Programming with Value Types. ‚è≥
  • Apple's Swift Standard Library Playground - experiment with Swift standard library types and high-level concepts using visualizations and practical examples. ‚è≥

Playgrounds about Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

  • XCTest Playground (‚≠ê54) - Better looking tests for playgrounds.
  • Interactive Playground (‚≠ê53) - Exploring interactivity in Playgrounds.
  • Mondrian (‚≠ê4) - Make iOS app mockups in Swift 2.x playgrounds. ‚è≥

Playgrounds from Playgroundbooks / Functional Reactive Programming

  • iPad Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê28) - The sample playgroundbooks converted to playgrounds.

Theoretical Computer Science / Functional Reactive Programming

  • Logician (‚≠ê197) - Logic programming in Swift. üåü
  • Function Composition in Swift (‚≠ê58) - Exploration of function composition in Swift. üåü
  • Swift Adventures in Monad Land (‚≠ê172) - Learn about monads.
  • Functional Design Patterns (‚≠ê5) - A few functional programming concept and patterns.
  • Learn about transducers (‚≠ê80) - A little tutorial that explains transducers. ‚è≥
  • Swift Functors, Applicatives, and Monads in Pictures (‚≠ê68) - Companion to the article: Swift Functors, Applicatves, and Monads in Pictures. ‚è≥
  • Functors in Swift (‚≠ê6) - A playground to introduce Functors in Swift, and their practical usage. ‚è≥

Theoretical Computer Science / Algorithms and Data Structures

  • Swift Algorithm Club (‚≠ê29k) - Algorithms and data structures in Swift with explanations. üåü
  • Sorting Experiments - Alluring experiments with sorting algorithms in Swift, sort of.
  • Visual Binary Trees (‚≠ê58) - Effortless visualization of arbitrary Binary Trees, along with their pluggable traversal implementations. üåü
  • Julia Fractal Playground (‚≠ê261) - A Swift playground that generates beautiful Julia set fractal images.
  • DataStructures Playground (‚≠ê16) - Data Structures and Algorithms in Swift. ‚è≥
  • Swiftography (‚≠ê8) - Standard cryptographic algorithms in a Swift Playground. ‚è≥
  • Algorithms Playground (‚≠ê6) - Various algorithm implementation in Swift. ‚è≥
  • The Jelly Bean Problem (‚≠ê2) - The Jelly Bean problem from Wait But Why. ‚è≥
  • Euclidean Strings (‚≠ê1) - A playground leveraging ReSwift to generate Euclidean Strings. ‚è≥

Theoretical Computer Science / Languages

  • Tinting (‚≠ê0) - A small playground to demonstrate image tinting in UIKit. ‚è≥
  • Ray tracing Playground (‚≠ê16) - A playground and a series of articles on ray tracing, see also part 2 (‚≠ê6), 3 (‚≠ê7), 4 (‚≠ê3), 5 (‚≠ê5) üåü ‚è≥
  • WWDC16 Logo Playground - Drawing the WWDC16 logo in a playground. ‚è≥

UIKit And Graphics / Core Image

  • Interpolation Playground (‚≠ê63) - Playground demonstrating lerp, smooth step, Catcall-Rom and others! ‚è≥
  • CoreImage for Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê89) - Growing collection of CoreImage playgrounds from the upcoming book "CoreImage For Swift". üåü ‚è≥

UIKit And Graphics / Metal

  • METAL Playground (‚≠ê55) - Apple Metal framework playground. üåü ‚è≥

  • UIViewPropertyAnimator Playground (‚≠ê37) - Playground demonstrating UIViewPropertyAnimator.

UIKit And Graphics / SpriteKit

  • SceneKit Examples (‚≠ê21) - Experiment with SceneKit and Swift. ‚è≥

Audio / SpriteKit

  • Bach Playground (‚≠ê4) - A Simple Swift Playground that plays a brief piece by Bach with AVAudioEngine and AVMIDIPlayer.
  • PlayerNode Playground (‚≠ê5) - Playground using AVAudioEngine with a playernode and effects to play an audio file. üåü

Mathematics / SpriteKit

  • Lindenmayer Systems (‚≠ê12) - A Swift playground exploring Lindemayer systems.

Libraries and APIs / SpriteKit
